quest.name: Follow, Wander, Stumble, Listen
objectives: Search for Meteion while accompanied by Emet-Selch.
Continue searching for Meteion while accompanied by Emet-Selch.
Survey the area while accompanied by Emet-Selch.
Survey the next area while accompanied by Emet-Selch.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: A frantic search will avail us little. We must be clever about this...

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: In the Final Days, aether is twisted by the invasion of dynamis from beyond the star, its progress intensified by feelings of fear and despair and anguish...

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: Nay, I like not the picture which emerges with these latest pieces.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: My apologies, I... We should focus on the task at hand.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Correct me if I'm wrong, but Meteion renders herself invisible by matching her aetheric density to that of her surroundings, does she not?

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: If so, could we not then disrupt her concealment with a surfeit of aether? Much how Emet-Selch solidified your presence when first we met you!

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Don't be absurd. I can hardly channel aether to a recipient whose whereabouts are hidden from me.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Which is why we must all work together.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Forename will continue the search in the same manner as before, but this time with you in tow. Once shehe ascertains Meteion's likely location, you proceed to reveal our wayward familiar with a swift aetherial downpour!

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: Very clever. And thankfully, she has made herself easier to capture by fleeing towards Lethe.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: Assuming she is made visible, it should prove no great feat to herd her into a corner.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Then we have our plan. Forename and Emet-Selch will be our tracker and trapper respectively, while we others predict and obstruct Meteion's avenues of escape.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Emet-Selch and I will keep an eye on each other's aether to help coordinate our efforts. Let us be about it!

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: ...Well, it seems we are partners for the time being. Let us return to where we last saw Meteion and pick up the trail from there.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: I will keep myself in a state of preparedness, ready to rain down aether at a moment's notice─meaning it falls to you to keep the way clear.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Emet-Selch is now accompanying you. Keep him at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can leave Emet-Selch behind by entering a different area, or by speaking with him and selecting the option to part ways.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If you wish to have Emet-Selch accompany you again, return and speak with him at the original location.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Talk.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Part ways.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Now, did Meteion go straight ahead towards the pier...or did she stray from the path somewhere?

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: As the only one who can hear her voice, you will need to take the lead.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Are you sure you wish to part ways with Emet-Selch?

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Aren't you the one who went to all the trouble of traveling into the past to avert an impending apocalypse? But fine, fine, be my guest! I will await you at the entrance to Lethe.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: The would-be savior of Etheirys past and future returns. After you, my good hero.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Emet-Selch has yet to arrive. Be sure he is at your side before attempting to continue.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You should have Emet-Selch accompanying you before you attempt to reveal Meteion.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You calm your mind, your senses questing for any hint of Meteion's presence...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ...But you fail to hear her voice. She must be elsewhere.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Nothing this way? We try another route, then.

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: (-Meteion-)Why can't I fly? Are my functions being restricted!?

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: (-Meteion-)Hide─yes, I'll just have to hide, then. Where no one can find me...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meteion's anguished voice heads towards the water's edge...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: She went into the lake!? As if this wasn't tiresome enough...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Well, at least that open expanse should make her easier to find. We won't lose her this time!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Discuss the water's edge.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Ugh. The indignation, to drag my robe through the water. Hythlodaeus better not breathe a word of this to Azem...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Still, mild humiliation will be the least of our concerns if we fail to get our hands on Meteion!

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: We should be able to reach the bottom of this drop by climbing down the rocks at the water's edge.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Do not even think of dragging me over the falls. Final Days or no, if I end up drenched from head to toe, I swear I will feed you to a remora.

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Not here... I'm not here... Please...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: By that rock, is she? Very well!

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: What? Why can't I hide!?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: There's no need to run, Meteion!

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: We will hear your report, good or bad!

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Forename...? What are you saying? Everything is so faint...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: I'm sorry... I'm not strong enough. Stay away. I'm begging you...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Don't make me say it. It will break him. His poor, fragile heart...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Now we have a chance.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Once the others are in position, the two of us can herd her into their midst!

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Discuss the neus.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Keep after Meteion! Hythlodaeus and I will coordinate our movements!

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Is this neus not in use? It seems to have been left to the mercy of the elements...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Either way, it bears no trace of Meteion's essence. We move on!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You should have Emet-Selch accompanying you before attempting to herd Meteion towards Hythlodaeus and the others.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: There! I see her!

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Now, where to close the trap...?

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: If all Hermes means to do is listen to Meteion's report, then it is his right to do so.

dialogue.name: VENAS
dialogue.text: But once he receives the answers to his question, what then? The fate of the world may very well hinge upon the choice he makes in that moment...and we must be there when he makes it.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Why, Hermes? Why could you not leave well enough alone!?

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Will these answers assuage the pain you feel when a creation is returned to aether?

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Had you never cast your accursed question to the distant stars, you may have one day learned to be at peace upon this one...
